messages.content: Write a user story where I am enhancing the existing ecommerce page to accomodate mixed cabins view for the customers.. currenlty there are there cabin - Economy, business and first.. we need to create all the different combinations.. I think it will be totally 6.. when I click on the mixed cabin tile.. I will see the different combinations and once I select one.. I will see the benefits for the and I select the fare and navigates me to the next page.. this is applicable for both web and mweb..

As a customer visiting the ecommerce page,
I want to be able to view mixed cabins options for my flight,
So that I can choose a combination that meets my preferences and budget.

Enhancement:
Currently, the ecommerce page only shows three cabin options - Economy, Business, and First. I would like to enhance the page to accommodate mixed cabins view, where customers can see all the different combinations available.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. On the ecommerce page, a new tile labeled "Mixed Cabin" should be added alongside the existing cabin options.
2. When I click on the "Mixed Cabin" tile, a dropdown or popup window should appear displaying the different cabin combinations.
3. There should be a total of six combinations: Economy + Business, Economy + First, Business + Economy, Business + First, First + Economy, and First + Business.
4. Each combination should have a brief description highlighting the benefits and amenities offered.
5. Upon selecting a particular combination, the corresponding fare for that combination should be displayed prominently.
6. The selection of a fare should be made easy and intuitive for both web and mweb (mobile web) users.
7. Once I select a fare, clicking on it should navigate me to the next page in the booking flow for further details and confirmation.

Note: This enhancement should be implemented and visible on both the web and mobile web versions of the ecommerce page.
actually there is something like flex for each cabin class where we charge double.. so each cabin class can have multiple combinations.. to consider this also in US

As a customer visiting the ecommerce page,
I want to be able to view and select mixed cabins options, including flex fares, for my flight in the US,
So that I can choose the combination that best suits my preferences and budget.

Enhancement:
Currently, the ecommerce page only shows three cabin options - Economy, Business, and First. I would like to enhance the page to accommodate mixed cabins view with the flexibility of flex fares, where customers can see all the different combinations available in the US.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. On the ecommerce page, a new tile labeled "Mixed Cabin" should be added alongside the existing cabin options.
2. When I click on the "Mixed Cabin" tile, a dropdown or popup window should appear displaying the different cabin combinations available for the US.
3. Each cabin class should have multiple combinations, including flex fares, allowing customers to choose the most suitable option.
4. The combinations should follow the three cabin classes (Economy, Business, and First), with the possibility of combining any two classes.
5. Each combination should have a brief description highlighting the benefits and amenities offered, as well as the additional cost for the flex fare option.
6. Upon selecting a particular combination and fare, the corresponding total fare (including the flex fare cost) should be displayed prominently.
7. The selection of a fare should be easy to navigate and understand on both web and mobile web (mweb) versions of the ecommerce page.
8. Once I select a fare, clicking on it should navigate me to the next page in the booking flow for further details and confirmation.

Note: This enhancement should be implemented and visible on both the web and mweb versions of the ecommerce page specifically for flights in the United States, considering the additional flexibility of flex fares within each cabin class.
we have economy and economy double, business and business double, first and first double.. so how many combinations exist excluding the same cabin type

Apologies for the confusion. Considering the combinations without including the same cabin type, the number of combinations would be 3. Here are the possible combinations:

1. Economy + Business
2. Economy + First
3. Business + First
I mean Economy+Business and Economy double+business is not allowed.. now give me all the different combinations

I apologize for the misunderstanding. There are six different cabin combinations excluding the same cabin type. Here are all the different combinations:

1. Economy + Business 
2. Economy + First 
3. Business + Economy 
4. Business + First 
5. First + Economy 
6. First + Business
I mean Economy+Business and Economy double+business is not allowed.. either one is allowed.. then give me all the combinations..

Apologies for the confusion. Based on your clarification, here are all the possible combinations:

1. Economy
2. Business
3. First
4. Economy + Business
5. Economy + First
6. Business + First

evidence: Write a user story where I am enhancing the existing ecommerce page

interactionPattern.rationale: User requests a product artifact (user story) and later constraints; AI responds with structured user story/acceptance criteria and enumerated outputs.

evidence: Note: This enhancement should be implemented and visible on both the web and mobile web versions
